textline.text: Curriculum Vitae
Ori Swed
oriswed@utexas.edu
Mailing Address: Affiliations:
University of Texas at Austin Department of Sociology
CLA 4.612, Mailcode A1700 Schusterman Center for Jewish Studies
Austin, TX 78712 Population Research Center
Tel: 512-4718452 IC2 Institute
Education
Ex. 2016 Ph.D. Candidate at the Sociology Department at the University of
Texas at Austin.
Dissertation title: “Aid in Conflict: Nongovernmental Organizations and State
Repression”
2013 Teaching Scholars Certificate Seminar
2010 M.A. in History at the Hebrew University
Thesis: “Peripheral Sources of Power and their Effect on the Center”.
2007 B.A. (Joint Major) in History, Sociology and Anthropology at the Hebrew University.
Publications
2015. Swed Ori and Alex Weinreb .“Military Westernization and State Repression in the Post-
Cold War Era” Social Science Research
2015. Swed Ori and John S. Butler as co-author- “Military Capital in the Israeli Hi-Tech
Industry” Armed Forces & Society 41.1 (2015): 123-141
2015. Under review. Ori Swed. “The Limits of Organization Expansion: The NGO Sector’s
Expansion Trends in Conflict Areas”.
2015. Book Review. Ori Swed. "How 9/11 Changed our Ways of War" in Res Militaris.
2014. Ori Swed. “NGOs in Conflict: A ‘Third Actor’ and its Effects on Human Rights” in Israel
Institute (1).
2010. Ori Swed. “Renan and Sand: Literature Review on Nationality and Jewish Identity”.
Pikpuk- The Sociology Journal of the Hebrew University. Volume 16. February 2010 (in
Hebrew).
2009. Ori Swed. "From Crucifixion to Hibernation: Fantasy and pain in the movie Waltz with
Bashir" 66-74. Slil Summer edition. (in Hebrew).
2009. Ori Swed. “The Changing of The Guard in The Late 19th Century Balance of Forces: The
Far East as a Case Study.” Hazira Ha’historit 1 (2). (in Hebrew).
Awards, Fellowships, and Honors
2014-15. Israel Institute Doctoral Fellowship.
2014. Professional Development Award.
2014. The Graduate Dean’s Prestigious Fellowship.
2013-14. Israel Institute Doctoral Fellowship.
2013. The 2013 Pre-Doctoral Fellowship.
2012. Pass with Honors on the General Examination in Political Sociology.
2012. Professional Development Award.
2009. Damascus Jewry Organization in Israel Fellowship.
2008. Damascus Jewry Organization in Israel Fellowship.
2006. Ministry of Education Award.
2005. Excellence in Service Scholarship.
Teaching Experience
2015. Fall. Instructor on Record for the course: Comparative Religion, Culture, and Politics. For
undergraduate level at the Sociology Department.
2015. Summer. Teaching-Assistant for Dr. Hossain Haghshenas, Department of Sociology,
University of Texas at Austin for Introduction to the Study of Society course.
2015. Spring. Lecturer for the course: NGOs in Israel and Northern Ireland: Aid in Conflict
Areas, for upper-division level at Israel Studies.
2014. Fall. Instructor on Record for the course: Social Change and the Future, for undergraduate
level at the Sociology Department.
2014 Summer. Instructor on Record for the course: Religion and Global Change, for upper-
division level in the Sociology Department.
2013 Fall. Instructor on Record for the course: Comparative Religion, Culture, and Politics.
For undergraduate level at the Sociology Department.
2013 Spring. Instructor on Record for the course: Social Change and the Future, for
undergraduate level at the Sociology Department.
2012. Spring. Teaching-Assistant for Dr. Brian Roberts, Department of Sociology, University of
Texas at Austin for Sociological Theory course.
2011. Spring. Teaching-Assistant for Dr. Mark Warr, Department of Sociology, University of
Texas at Austin for Criminology course.
2010-2011. Fall. Teaching-Assistant for Dr. Robert Crosnoe, Department of Sociology,
University of Texas at Austin for Intro to Sociology course.
Academic Experience
2015. Ad-hoc reviewer for the Journal of Economics and International Finance.
2013-15. Research-assistant for Dr. John S. Butler at the IC2 Institute at the University of Texas
at Austin on the topic of “Information Poverty and the Welfare System: an examination of
the VA benefits’ use” focusing on the correlation between income and information
poverty and the usage of veteran benefits.
2014. June. Participation in the Israeli Institute Leadership Summit.
2014. March. Participation in Duty to Care Symposium workshop. CSIS. Washington, DC.
2014. Mentoring at the at the IE Pre Grad Internship program.
2013-14. Ad-hoc reviewer for the Armed Forces & Society Journal.
2013. Ad-hoc reviewer for the Law & Social Inquiry Journal.
2013 Summer. Field research in Israel for a study on the Political Geography of East Jerusalem
with the cooperation with Dr. Ami Pedhazur from the Government department and the
Schusterman Center for Jewish Studies.
2013. April. Participation in the Terrorists, Insurgents, and Guerrillas (TIGER) lab workshop.
2012. Research-assistant for Dr. John S. Butler at the IC2 Institute at the University of Texas at
Austin on the topic of “Military and High Tech Relations” focusing on the unique
relations between the IDF and the Israeli High-Tech Industry.
2012 December. Preliminary field research in Israel for a study on the Political Geography of
East Jerusalem with the cooperation with Dr. Ami Pedhazur from the Government
department and the Schusterman Center for Jewish Studies.
2011. Creation of Counterinsurgency Dynamics in the Second Intifada Data Base (COINDY)
This with the collaboration and guidance of Dr. Alex Weinreb from the Sociology
Department at the University of Texas at Austin.
2011. Field research in Israel on the IDF capital and the local high-tech industry. With the
cooperation and support of Dr. John Butler.
2011. Research-assistant for Dr. John S. Butler at the IC2 Institute at the University of Texas at
Austin on the topic of “Military and High Tech Relations” focusing on the unique
relations between the IDF and the Israeli High-Tech Industry.
2006-2009. Research-assistant for Dr. Alexander Weinreb, Department of Sociology and
Anthropology, Hebrew University. The first year was primarily focused on the historical
representation of sub-Saharan Africa (e.g., ancient, medieval, and early modern pictures).
The second year and third years were primarily spent identifying, sorting and coding
epidemics.
2008-2009. Founder and chief editor of the student internet periodical "The Historical Arena,"
that addresses military history issues.
2007 (August – September). Directed a pilot study in a rural area of Central Malawi involving
the collection of social interaction diaries (PI was Dr. Alexander Weinreb)
Work in Progress
“Information Poverty and the Welfare System: an examination of the VA benefits’ use” -with
Dr. Butler as coauthor.
“From Frames to Policy”- on frames as explanatory variable for coalition formation.
“Changing the Political Geography: Social Movements in East Jerusalem” in collaboration with
Dr. Illana Shpaizman and Dr. Ami Pedahzur. – on Social Movements in East Jerusalem.
“Historical contingency and Liner Past”- on historical perspective in social science research.
“Peripheral Sources of Power”- on the political effect of power and geography in civil war.
Research Presentation
2015. October. “Aid in Conflict: Nongovernmental Organizations and State Repression” was
accepted for the 2015 IUS Conference.
2014. November. “The liberalizing potential of military westernization in the post-Cold War
era”. International Security Studies Section of ISA and the International Security and
Arms Control Section of APSA Conference 2014. Austin, Texas.
2014. October. “Urban settlements and political entrepreneurship in East Jerusalem”. The
annual meeting of the Peace Science Society workshop. Philadelphia.
2014. May. Present a paper “The Rise of NGOs in Conflict Areas”. Canadian Sociology
Association Annual Conference. St. Catharines.
2013. October. Invited Speaker. “Historical Contingency and the Israeli-Palestinian Conflict”.
Institute for National Security and Counterterrorism (INSCT) at Syracuse University.
2013 August. Present a paper “Military Capital and the Israeli Hi-Tech Industry”. American
Sociological Association: Annual Meeting 2013. New York.
2013 April. Invited Speaker. “Civil-Military Relations in the Israeli Context”. Austin Jewish
Academy. Austin, Texas.
2013 March. Present a paper “The Israeli Model of Hi-Tech Entrepreneurship, Military Capital,
and the Hi-Tech Industry“. Eastern Sociological Society Annual Meeting. Boston.
2013 February. Invited Speaker. “Israel and its Current Challenges with Iran” Cowan Creek
Center. Georgetown.
2012. Presented Paper- From Mercenaries to Contractors. Go-Betweeness: Crossing Borders
‘Human Rights? Social Justice?‘– An Interdisciplinary Conference at the University of
Texas at Austin.
2012. Presented Paper- The Arab Spring and the Role of the Military: Coercion and Diffusion
through Arms Sales. ASA, section “Peace, War, World Conflict, and Conflict Resolution”
Denver.
2012. Invited Speaker- Iran and the Middle-East Geopolitics. Beth Shalom community. Dell
Jewish Community Campus Austin.
2012. Presented Paper- The Role of the Military in the Arab-Spring. Eastern Sociological
Society Annual Meeting. New York.
2011. Presented Paper- The Dynamics of Violence between State and Terror Organizations in
Israel and Palestine. Brown Bag Talk at the Sociology Department at the University of
Texas at Austin.
Languages
English (Native or bilingual proficiency)
Hebrew (Native or bilingual proficiency)
German (Limited working proficiency)
Spanish (Limited working proficiency)
Skills
Software packages for quantitative data analysis STATA and R
Software packages for network analysis Gephi and UCINET
Software packages for data visualization and Geo-data analysis Tableau and GIS
Software packages for textual analysis Rapidminder and DocuBurst
